content.raw:
should we call this `rot` to stay consistent with gazebo notation?

alternatively, we could just spell out `position` and `orientation` here.
content.html:
should we call this rot to stay consistent with gazebo notation?

alternatively, we could just spell out position and orientation here.

I'm conflicted...

Generally I think of "translation" and "rotation" as actions, and "position" and "orientation" as qualities. So a "transformation" is made up of a "translation" and a "rotation", while a "pose" is made up of "position" and "orientation". But these are all semantic differences and mathematically they're all the same... Also, abbreviating "translation" as "trans" is confusing because it could be the same abbreviation as "transform". "pos" is much nicer as an abbreviation, as is "rot".

struct _hxTransform
{
  hxVector3 translation;
  hxVector3 rotation;
}

or

struct _hxPose
{
  hxVector3 position;
  hxVector3 orientation;
}

but I'm not committed to a particular representation...

content.raw: getting the [complete reactive forces and torques at a joint](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6977194dfe4b0412c365cc439c7c91c2452cfba3/gazebo/physics/Joint.hh?at=default#cl-330) is probably more useful here.  Let's define a `_hxWrench` and provide that information?
content.html: getting the complete reactive forces and torques at a joint is probably more useful here. Let's define a _hxWrench and provide that information?

I have mixed feelings about introducing a hxWrench struct. I agree that we should provide complete force and torque information at the joint, but it creates another nested layer of indexing. For example:

hxSimInfo simInfo;
hxs_siminfo(simInfo);
hxVector3 force = simInfo.models[i].joints[i].wrench_reactive.force;

vs.

hxSimInfo simInfo;
hxs_siminfo(simInfo);
hxVector3 force = simInfo.models[i].joints[i].force_reactive;

It's a minor point though. If we provide an hxs_wrench function it would certainly be useful to have an hxWrench structure. I also don't know whether or not the users of the API are used to thinking of a force/torque pair as a wrench.

content.raw: The refactoring in haptix-comm wasn't so bad. Added a wrench struct in ac2f844
content.html: The refactoring in haptix-comm wasn't so bad. Added a wrench struct in ac2f844

Shouldn't this actually be "**get** the linear velocity of a model"? We have `set_model_link_state` for this now, kind of... If this is to be used to set the model linear velocity, it should really be `set_linear_velocity` instead. @caguero, @hsu, thoughts?
